availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, saddler. Pennsylvania native. Married to Henrietta Weatherly. Father of Mary Weatherly and Isabella Weatherly. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in 1850. Saddler in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 58B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 1-2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 7.
Find A Grave, "George L. Weatherly (November 7, 1815-March 17, 1882)," Memorial #34296999, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/34296999 (accessed March 24, 2017).
